data.title: Meet Carly Rose Sonenclar
data.meta_description: 13-year-old Carly Rose Sonenclar gets a standing ovation from the judges and audience at the X-Factor audition with Nina Simone's "Feeling Good."
data.text:
Carly began singing when she was 2 years old and started her professional career at age 7 in "The Night of the Hunter" at the New York Musical Theater Festival in which she played the lead role of Pearl. In that same year, she made her Broadway debut in Les Miserables as Young Cosette. At age 10 she appeared in the national tour of "Little House of the Prairie the Musical" in the principal role of Carrie. New York Times theater critic Charles Isherwood described Carly as an "almost preternaturally skilled singer." At age 12, Carly was named the "2011 Best Young Performer" by broadwayworld.com.
